noun.description: Pressure or tension exerted on a material object.
examples: the distribution of stress is uniform across the bar

noun.description: A state of mental or emotional strain or tension resulting from adverse or very demanding circumstances.
examples: he's obviously under a lot of stress

noun.description: Physiological disturbance or damage caused to an organism by adverse circumstances.
examples: in many areas irrigation is warranted to avoid plant stress
he has started to lay greater stress on the government's role in industry

verb.description: Give particular emphasis or importance to (a point, statement, or idea) made in speech or writing.
examples: they stressed the need for reform
she was anxious to stress that her daughter's safety was her only concern
“I want it done very, very neatly,” she stressed
this type of workout does stress the shoulder and knee joints

verb.description: Cause mental or emotional strain or tension in.
examples: I avoid many of the things that used to stress me before

origin: Acronym from str(uctural) e(ngineering) s(ystems) s(olver).
